channel.title: Java on David Raab
channel.description: Recent content in Java on David Raab

item.title: Java's type ereasure
item.description: Here is some knowledge that i gathered how Java’s typing system works. Don’t know which version. But it’s an older one. Somwhere around Java 6 to Java 8. Maybe it changed now. Consider that generics was added to Java, and it was not a default of the language. When Java would have started with Generics, it might have evolved different. So a common problem you have is storing data in an Array.
